edu.dynamic.dynamiz.storage

Class Storage

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.dynamic.dynamiz.storage.Storage

  • public class Storage
extends java.lang.Object
    Defines the storage class holding the list of tasks and events. Public Methods(currently that can be used) static Storage getInstance() //gets the Storage instance ToDoItem addItem(ToDoItem item) //Adds the given item to the list. ToDoItem[] getList(OptionType[] options) //Gets the full list of items. ToDoItem[] getList(String[] keywords, int[] priority, MyDate[] start, MyDate end, OptionsType[] optionsList) //Gets the filtered list of items. ToDoItem removeItem(String id) //Removes the item with the specified id from this storage. ToDoItem[] searchItems(int id) //Gets the ToDoItem with the given ID. ToDoItem[] searchItems(String keyword, int priority, MyDate start, MyDate end, OptionType[] optList) //Gets a list of items with the given parameter values. ToDoItem[] updateItem(String id, String description, int priority, Date start, Date end) //Updates the ToDoItem with the given id with the specified details. ToDoItem markItem(int id) //Marks the ToDoItem with the given id as completed ToDoItem unmarkItem(int id) //Marks the ToDoItem with the given id as not completed. void markItem(ToDoItem item) //Marks the given ToDoItem as completed. void unmarkItem(ToDoItem item) //Marks the given ToDoItem as not completed.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static Storage getInstance()
        Gets the Storage instance.
        Returns:
        The only Storage instance of this class.

      • addItem

        public ToDoItem addItem(ToDoItem item)
        Adds the given item to the list. For use by CommandDelete's undo method.
        Parameters:
        item - The ToDoItem to be added to the list.
        Returns:
        The TodoItem that is added to the list.

      • updateItem

        public ToDoItem[] updateItem(int id,
                             java.lang.String description,
                             int priority,
                             MyDate start,
                             MyDate end)
                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Updates the item with the given id with the specified changes.
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the item to update.
        description - The new description of the target object.
        priority - The new priority for the item to be updated, use a negative number to indicate no change to priority.
        start - The new start date for the item, or null if start date is not to be changed.
        end - The new end date for the item, or null if end date is not to be changed.
        Returns:
        The updated ToDoItem.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if there is no such item with the given id.

      • searchItems

        public ToDoItem[] searchItems(int id)
                       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Gets the ToDoItem with the given ID, or null if no such ToDoItem exists.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the ToDoItem to search.
        Returns:
        A 1-element array of the ToDoItem with the given ID, or null, if no such ToDoItem exists.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • searchItems

        public ToDoItem[] searchItems(java.lang.String keyword,
                              int priority,
                              MyDate start,
                              MyDate end,
                              java.lang.String status,
                              OptionType[] optList)
        Gets a list of ToDoItem objects whose description contains this keyword.
        Parameters:
        keyword - The keyword to search in the objects or null if no search by keyword is needed.
        priority - The priority level to the item(s) to search or -1 if not needed.
        start - the start date of the item(s) to search or null if search by start date is not needed.
        end - The end date of the item(s) to search or null if search by end date is not needed.
        status - the status of the item(s)to search or null if search by status is not needed.
        optList - The list of options(in descending precedence) to sort search results by.
        Returns:
        An array of ToDoItem objects containing all of the given values or null if the list is empty.

      • getList

        public ToDoItem[] getList(int[] priority,
                          MyDate[] start,
                          MyDate[] end,
                          OptionType[] options)
        Gets the list of items filtered using the given field values, sorted using the given options list in descending order of precedence. If no filtering values are used at all, the full list of items will be returned instead.
        Parameters:
        priority - The list of priority values used for filtering or null if not used.
        start - The list of start dates used for filtering or null if not used.
        end - The list of end dates used for filtering or null if not used.
        options - The list of field types in descending order of precedence used to sort the list.
        Returns:
        A filtered array of ToDoItem sorted using options.

      • getEvents

        public EventItem[] getEvents()
        Returns a list of events sorted in lexicographical order of their ID.
        Returns:
        An array of EventItem objects sorted in lexicographical order of their ID or null if the list is empty.

      • getTasks

        public TaskItem[] getTasks()
        Returns a list of deadline tasks in lexicographical order or their ID.
        Returns:
        An array of TaskItem objects sorted in lexicographical order of their ID or null if the list is empty.

      • getEventsSortedByStartDate

        public EventItem[] getEventsSortedByStartDate()
        Gets the list of events sorted in ascending order of start date.
        Returns:
        An array of EventItem sorted in ascending order by start date or null if the list is empty. Implementation is currently only a stub, to be properly implemented when use case requirements are confirmed.

      • getEventsSortedByEndDate

        public EventItem[] getEventsSortedByEndDate()
        Gets the list of events sorted in ascending order of end date.
        Returns:
        An array of EventItem sorted in ascending order by start date or null if the list is empty. Implementation is currently only a stub, to be properly implemented when use case requirements are confirmed.

      • getTasksSortedByDeadline

        public TaskItem[] getTasksSortedByDeadline()
        Gets the list of deadline tasks sorted in ascending order of their deadlines.
        Returns:
        An array of TaskItem objects sorted in ascending order of their deadlines.

      • removeItem

        public ToDoItem removeItem(int id)
                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Removes the ToDoItem with the given ID from the list. For use by CommandAdd's undo method and CommandDelete's execute method.
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the ToDoItem object to remove from the list.
        Returns:
        The ToDoItem object that was removed from the list by this operation.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if no item with the given ID is found.

      • markItem

        public ToDoItem markItem(int id)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Marks the item with the given ID as completed.
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the item to mark as completed.
        Returns:
        The ToDoItem that is marked as completed or null if the item has already been marked as completed.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if there is no item with the given ID.

      • markItem

        public void markItem(ToDoItem item)
        Marks the given ToDoItem as completed.
        Parameters:
        item - The ToDoItem to marks as completed.

      • unmarkItem

        public ToDoItem unmarkItem(int id)
                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Unmark the most recent item that is marked completed.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the ToDoItem to unmark.
        Returns:
        The ToDoItem object that is unmarked from completed list or null if this item's status is already not 'completed'.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if no item with the given ID exists.

        Parameters:
        item - The ToDoItem to unmark.
